alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 11 at 8:48PM CST until January 14 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Perryville For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Perryville. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 362.0 feet, In Perry County, Crooked Creek Campground and Marina near the boat launch area is flooding along with the access road to the camping area near the mouth of Crooked Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 361.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 362.0 feet Thursday morning. - Action stage is 362.0 feet. - Flood stage is 365.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
